I was attempting to test the multi-install feature in 2.1M4.  I selected my 
features, and proceeded through the wizard.  After clicking finish, a dialog 
came up to tell me that the Jar was unsigned.  I clicked through this dialog, 
and was immediately prompted with a dialog box.  The message in the dialog box 
read "Thread Access Error".

There is at least one problem here, quite possible two.

First, the error message is awful.  This needs to be fixed regardless of who 
caused the error.  Some information that the user can actually use should be 
provided, or the user should simply be told that the action couldn't be 
completed.

Secondly, The features I was attempting to install work on previous versions of 
eclipse.  So I highly suspect the multi-install mechanism as the source of the 
problem.  Note: These features will single install properly into eclipse.

The message you got is not a message a user would encounter in a working 
product. It is an exception report and the message simply tells what happened. 
It is an internal error that is caused by a bug and should be fixed. Do not 
compare them with errors like 'Unable to connect to the server' and such, which 
are indication of normal problems resulted from the usage conditions, not an 
application fault.

I think we fixed that problem in builds >M4. M5 aka RC0 is about to be 
declared, to try this again and tell us if you still see it. If so, we will fix 
it in time for RC1.

Sorry, I can see now from the stack that the problem is not in the group 
install wizard but in the multiple-selection page. The problem is that the 
change notification is fired from a second thread and event must be processed 
on a GUI thread because it accesses SWT widgets.

We will fix this.

As a work-around, don't select all objects in the 'Selected Updates' view - 
just use 'Process All' action and all the jobs in the lists will be processed.
